docs.title: RAG Notes
docs.text: A repository for documenting project notes and maintaining learning documentation using MkDocs and Material theme.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
This site is built with MkDocs and hosted free on GitHub Pages.

  • Local development: uv run mkdocs serve --livereload
  • Live site: https://kbhatiya999.github.io/rag-notes/
  • Source code: https://github.com/kbhatiya999/rag-notes

Use the navigation menu to find setup instructions, deployment guides, and more.

docs.title: Deploy to GitHub Pages
docs.text: Host your docs for free using GitHub Pages.

docs.title: Deploy Your Site
docs.text:
Make sure your mkdocs.yml includes:

site_url: https://<your-username>.github.io/rag-notes/
repo_url: https://github.com/<your-username>/rag-notes
repo_name: rag-notes

Then deploy:

uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

This builds your site and pushes it to the gh-pages branch on GitHub.

docs.title: Access Your Live Site
docs.text:
Your docs are now live at:

https://<your-username>.github.io/rag-notes/

Note: The first deployment may take a few minutes. Refresh the link after 2-3 minutes.

docs.title: Update After Changes
docs.text:
After making changes and pushing to GitHub:

git add .
git commit -m "Update docs"
git push
uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

Or combine into one command:

git add . && git commit -m "Update docs" && git push && uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
• mkdocs gh-deploy builds your site and creates a gh-pages branch
  • GitHub Pages serves content from this branch automatically
  • Keep your source code on main, site is on gh-pages

docs.title: Commit Your Changes
docs.text:
First, commit all your local changes:

git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit: setup rag-notes repo with MkDocs and Material theme"

docs.title: Create GitHub Repository
docs.text:
Create a remote repository on GitHub and push your code using gh (GitHub CLI):

gh repo create rag-notes --source=. --remote=origin --push --public

Replace --public with --private if you want a private repository.

This will: - Create a new repository on GitHub - Connect your local repo to this remote (origin) - Push all your local commits to GitHub

docs.title: Verify Connection
docs.text:
git remote -v

You should see your GitHub repo URL listed.

Your repo is now live at: https://github.com/<your-username>/rag-notes

docs.title: Push Future Changes
docs.text:
After making changes locally:

git add .
git commit -m "Your commit message"
git push

Or as a shorthand:

git add . && git commit -m "Your message" && git push

docs.title: Initial Project Setup
docs.text:
Initialize the project with uv:

uv init rag-notes --no-package

Navigate into the project:

cd rag-notes

Now you're in: ~/RAGprojects/rag-notes

Add MkDocs dependencies:

uv add mkdocs mkdocs-material

Initialize the MkDocs structure:

uv run mkdocs new .

docs.title: Theme Configuration (mkdocs.yml)
docs.text:
Your project's appearance is controlled by mkdocs.yml:

site_name: RAG Notes
site_url: https://kbhatiya999.github.io/rag-notes/
repo_url: https://github.com/kbhatiya999/rag-notes
repo_name: rag-notes

theme:
  name: material
  palette:
    # Palette toggle for light mode
    - scheme: default
      toggle:
        icon: material/brightness-7
        name: Switch to dark mode

    # Palette toggle for dark mode
    - scheme: slate
      toggle:
        icon: material/brightness-4
        name: Switch to light mode

After editing mkdocs.yml, restart uv run mkdocs serve --livereload to see changes.

docs.title: Running Locally
docs.text:
Start the documentation server with live reload:

uv run mkdocs serve --livereload

Visit http://127.0.0.1:8000 to preview your docs.
